articles.title: Spain, Portugal report monkeypox cases, raising specter of wider outbreak - STAT
articles.description: Two more European countries reported unusual monkeypox cases on Wednesday, a development that suggests an outbreak first spotted in the United Kingdom is more widespread than first believed.
articles.content:

articles.title: Monkeypox outbreak spreads in Europe as UK, Portugal confirm cases - CBC News
articles.description: Portuguese authorities said on Wednesday they had identified five cases of rare monkeypox infection and Spain's health services are testing eight potential cases after Britain put Europe on alert for the virus.

articles.title: Could Finland and Sweden's bid to join NATO spell the end of 'neutral' European countries? - ABC News
articles.description: Finland and Sweden's announcement that they intend to join NATO has dashed Vladimir Putin's hopes his war in Ukraine would deter expansion of the military alliance. But could it also mark the end of neutral states in Europe?
